title: Exxon Crushes Q3 Forecasts on Record Guyana and Permian Output
summary: Exxon Mobil (NYSE: XOM) topped Wall Street expectations for the third quarter, posting $8.1 billion in adjusted earnings, or $1.88 per share—up from $7.1 billion in Q2—on record output from Guyana and the Permian Basin. title: Chevron's Hess Acquisition Boosts Q3 Output Beyond Expectations
summary: Chevron reported stronger-than-expected third-quarter results on Friday, supported by record oil and gas production following its roughly $53-billion acquisition of Hess Corporation. title: U.S. Rig Count Falls Despite Record Production
summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States fell this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday.
